creator: david@cokinetic.com
text:
I assume that this is an enhancement.  If it exists, I can't find it or any 
mention of how to do it. 
I would like a way to have the HTTP connector send the content-length as part 
of the response.  I realize that the response is dynamically generated, but I 
would like the server to automatically calculate the content-length and set it 
in the header.  Maybe this should be an attribute of the HTTP/1.1 connector in 
the server.xml file.

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
Note that you can accomplish this yourself by using a Filter.  That way, no app
except yours has to pay the performance overhead of the double buffering that is
required to implement it.

Coyote HTTP/1.1 will calculate the content-length if:
- the whole response fits in the buffer
- the response is not committed before the servlet completes its execution
